result.execSummary:
The defendant Xai Chang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF131.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF131.

-Regular and random testing.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing or illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
-Follow any additional programming recommended by Agent.
-Participate in MRT.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

- Regular and random testing. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Follow any additional programming recommended by agent.

- DE to participate in MRT
- DE to provide a DNA sample and any surcharges associated

Count 6
- Costs
- 30 days St. Croix County Jail
  Credit for time served.

4  years initial confinement, 5 years ES

- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Costs

- DE to participate in MRT

Count 6

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Xai  Chang appeared in 14CF131.
Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  John O'Boyle  DF:  Tony Xiong appeared in 14CF133. JURY TRIAL - DAY 3. **OFF RECORD DISCUSSIONS WITH ATTORNEYS** Case called  8:44 a.m. Court notes off record discussions re: jury instructions and cites agreement. Discussions as to alternate juror.  Discussions as to polling jurors. Adjourned. Jury in and case recalled at 9:03 a.m. Direct of SCC Investigator James Haefner by Atty O'Boyle. Cross by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty Perrin. Redirect by ADA Hahn. S/T - SCC Investigator James Mikla. Direct by Atty O'Boyle. Side bar 9:29 a.m. Direct continues by Atty O'Boyle. Side bar 9:38 a.m. Direct continues. Cross by ADA Hahn 9:44 a.m. Side bar. Cross continues by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty Perrin 9:54 a.m. Redirect by Atty O'Boyle. Jury out at 10:05 a.m. Defendants continue to waive rights to testify. Jury in and case recalled at 10:22 a.m. Court addresses questions by jurors of Investigator Mikla. Attorneys stipulate to August 18 trial date. Court recites agreement as to Exhibits. Evidence is closed. Jury instructions given by the Court. Closing arguments by ADA Hahn 11:02 a.m. Adjourned at 11:28 a.m. Recalled 11:34 a.m. Closing arguments by Atty Perrin. Closing arguments by Atty O'Boyle 11:51 a.m. Rebuttal by ADA Hahn 12:13 p.m. Oath to Bailiff 12:38 p.m. Jury out to deliberate at 12:39 p.m. Discussions as to instructions and exhibits. Exhibits 1 - 20 to be provided to the jury. Adjourned at 12:41 p.m. Recalled at 2:12 p.m.  Attorneys and Defendants present. Discussions and agreement as to jury question. Adjourned at 2:14 p.m. Recalled at 3:23 p.m. Attorneys and Defendants present. Discussions and agreement as to jury question. Adjourned at 3:25 p.m. Jury in and case recalled at 7:35 p.m. Verdict reached. 

In 14CF131, Jury finds DE Chang guilty of possession with intent to deliver methamphetamine, more than 3 grams and guilty of possession of drug paraphernalia.

In 14CF133, Jury finds DE Xiong guilty of possession with intent to deliver methamphetamine, more than 3 grams and guilty of possession of drug paraphernalia.

Jury polled at 7:38 pm. Jury excused at 7:41 p.m. ADA Hahn moves Crt to accept as true verdicts. Court accepts as true verdicts. Court enters judgment of conviction. Bail revoked. Defendants remanded to SCC jail. Court orders PSI to be completed within 60 days for both defendants. Attorneys to set sentencing hearing with JA. Adjourned at 7:45 p.m. kes

JURY TRIAL - DAY 2. Case called at 8:25 a.m. with Attorneys and Defendants present. Discussions as to exhibits. State Exhibit 99 O/R. Discussions as to witnesses. Discussions as to priors. Adjourned at 8:39 a.m. Jury in and case called at 8:41 a.m. S/T - Pierce County Investigator Marty Shepler. Direct by ADA Hahn. DE identified. Cross by Atty Perrin 8:59 a.m. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Redirect by ADA Hahn 9:11 a.m. Recross by Atty O'Boyle. S/T - SCC Investigator James Haefner. Direct by ADA Hahn. DE Xiong identified. Cross by Atty Perrin. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Side bar 9:45 a.m. Recalled at 9:46 a.m. Cross continues. Redirect by ADA Hahn. Recross by Atty O'Boyle. Redirect. Jury out and adjourned at 9:53 a.m. Jury in and case recalled at 10:09 a.m. S/T - G. Carothers. Direct by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty Perrin 10:37 a.m. Cross by Atty O'Boyle 10:45 a.m. Side bar 10:48 a.m. Recalled at 10:49 a.m. Cross continues by Atty O'Boyle. Redirect by ADA Hahn 11:10 a.m. Recross by Atty Perrin 11:16 a.m. Redirect by ADA Hahn. Recross by Atty Perrin. Recross by Atty O'Boyle. Side bar. Recalled at 11:24 a.m. Questions by jurors. Side bar. Recalled at 11:26 a.m. ADA Hahn recalls Investigator Dean Fayerweather. Direct by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Court continues to reserve on Exhibits 26 and 27. Jury out at 11:37 a.m. *OFF RECORD DISCUSSIONS* Recalled at 11:41 a.m. with Attorneys and Defendants present. Discussions as to witnesses. Crt authorizes witness testimony. Adjourned at 11:47 a.m. Jury in and case recalled at 12:39 p.m. S/T - SCC Deputy Steve Drost. Direct by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Redirect by ADA Hahn. S/T - SCC Investigator Shawn Demulling. Direct by ADA Hahn. State Exhibit 29 - O/R. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. S/T - Kayla V. Direct by ADA Hahn. Side bar. Recalled at 1:13 p.m. Direct continues. Side bar. Direct continues at 1:24 p.m. Jury out and adjourned at 1:48 p.m. Jury in and case recalled at 2:06 p.m. Cross by Atty Perrin. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Side bar. Recalled at 2:27 p.m. Cross continues by Atty O'Boyle. Redirect by ADA Hahn. Recross by Atty Perrin. Redirect by ADA Hahn. Side bar. Recross by Atty Perrin 3:00 p.m. Redirect by ADA Hahn. Recross by Atty O'Boyle 3:07 p.m. State rests. Jury out at 3:11 p.m. *OFF RECORD DISCUSSIONS* Jury in and case recalled at 3:21 p.m. S/T - MN DOC Employee Shelly Schonauer. Direct by Atty O'Boyle. Cross by ADA Hahn. Court releases jurors for the day 3:28 p.m. Case recalled at 3:45 p.m. with Attorneys and defendants present. Discussions as to exhibits. State Exhibits 26 through 28 and 30 through 33, 99 - O/R. Exhibits 32 and 33 received only as to testimony. DE Exhibits 101, 103, 200 through 209 - O/R. DE Chang will remain silent. Court informs DE Chang of rights. Crt finds DE Chang freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights to testify. DE Xiong will remain silent. Crt informs DE Xiong of rights. Crt finds DE Xiong freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights to testify. Defendants are no longer present 4:02 p.m. *OFF RECORD DISCUSSION WITH ATTORNEYS*.

Case called at 8:23 a.m. Attorneys and DE's present. Discussions as to witness lists and trial procedure. Discussions as to motions in Limine. Clerk: Scobey.  Case called at 9:14 a.m with jury present. Oath of Jurors as to Qualifications given. Voir Dire by the Court 9:23 a.m. Adjourned 9:36 a.m. Discussion with Juror 1154 in chambers. Recalled 9:40 a.m. Juror 1154 stricken for cause. Juror 1104 stricken for cause. Juror 1140 stricken for cause. Adjourned at 10:37 a.m. Case recalled at 10:46 a.m. Same appearances. Voir Dire by Atty Perrin 10:58 a.m. Voir Dire by Atty O'Boyle 10:59 p.m. Peremptory strike 11:12 a.m. Oath of Jurors for Trial given 11:28 a.m. Jury out at 11:30 a.m. Jury in and case recalled at 11:49 a.m. Instructions given by the Court. Opening statements by ADA Hahn 12:03 p.m. Opening statements by Atty Perrin. Opening statements by Atty O'Boyle 12:15 p.m. Jury out at 12:25 p.m. Jury in and case called at 1:25 p.m. S/T - Baldwin PD Officer Chad Gallmeier. Direct by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty Perrin 1:38 p.m. Side bar 1:39 p.m. Cross continues 1:41 p.m. Cross by Atty O'Boyle 1:43 p.m. Redirect by ADA Hahn. State Exhibits 1 through 15 O/R. Recross by Atty Perrin. S/T - Baldwin PD Chief Darren Krueger. Direct by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty Perrin. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Redirect by ADA Hahn. S/T - SCC Investigator Dean Fayerweather. Direct by ADA Hahn. Jury out at 2:53 p.m. and case adjourned. Jury in and case recalled 3:12 p.m. Cross by Atty Perrin of Investigator Fayerweather. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Redirect by ADA Hahn. Adjourned and jury out at 3:45 p.m. Jury in and case recalled at 3:52 p.m. Redirect continues by ADA Hahn. Recross by Atty Perrin. Recross by Atty O'Boyle. State Exhibits 16 through 25, 28 - O/R. Court reserves on Exhibits 26 and 27. S/T - State Crime Lab Analyst David Hannon. Atty's stipulate to qualifications of Analyst Hannon. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. S/T - State Crime Lab Analyst Samantha Delfosse. Direct by ADA Hahn. Atty's stipulate to qualifications of Analyst Delfosse. Cross by Atty Perrin. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Direct continues by ADA Hahn. Recross by Atty O'Boyle. Side bar 4:43 p.m. Recalled at 4:44 p.m. Jury out at 4:47 p.m. OFF RECORD DISCUSSIONS WITH ATTORNEYS.  Bond continues in form and amount. Discussions as to Exhibits 25 through 28. Investigator Haefner takes custody of Exhibits 25 through 28 and 205. Adjourned at 4:50 p.m.

Preliminary hearing on April 4, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Subject to random testing.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Tony X. or Kayla V.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Defendant to sign a pre-signed waiver of extradition.
